result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Dietz

records.addlTxt: Status Conference set for 12/02/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

If information is not filed it will be and it will mirror the criminal complaint.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant will be excused from participating in the PTC.

State is in compliance with victim rights notification.

3:02 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Christopher J Dietz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:28 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appeared on behalf of Attorney Anne Renc for Christopher J Dietz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Bond continued 

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:43 PM Defendant Christopher J Dietz in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Defendant states that he as an Attorney.
ADA Dodge states that Atty Renc represents him on other cases.
Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
ADA Dodge provides the defendant with a copy of the complaint.
ADA Dodge has no objection to the adjournment.
ADA Dodge would request a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned.
